6f6564ec4b09a5f66bd3307cfe1a46c1700f4612 Use /bin/bash and not /bin/sh; /bin/sh is on some distributions the bourne shell while on other distributions it is the posix shell. There are subtle compatibility issues between bourne and posix shell. As such, it is safer to explicitly use bash so that it works fine on all linux distributions, as well as on modern unix flavours that contain bash

6413eb62c6f14c2de93c0f475141fb2b68071065 Support 15 bpp in SuperImposedFrame. This fixes a crash when openMSX is compiled with only 16 bpp support and the native video supports only 32 bpp. In this case SDL transparently converts from 16 bpp to 32 bpp, but the surface SDL offers to openMSX has BitsPerPixel set to 15, not 16.

52687fcc4b691409d26589085943a38450b8cb94 The LD1100 protocol is not understood by the Pioneer LD-700, it is only understood by the Pioneer LD-1100. We should not emulate both at the same time as this could not happen in real hardware.

54f78c6dd081deaa8604f5f3a58f31d312a044f0 The NEC protocol sends LSB first, not MSB. This change reverses the order the bits are parsed, but should not change the functionality. The codes make much more sense this way (for example the numbers are simply 0 - 9 now).

67135d3d9b3fced9bfc0dcdb77c2bfd186bb9369 Don't store the verticalAdjust value, since it is used only once per frame.
d26a78e523a2e166949022becf13d3deb8135b96 Fixed initialization of lineZero during overscan. Before, displayStart was set to the end of the top erase (the overscan display start), but lineZero was set to the end of the top border (the non-overscan display start). As a result, the line interrupt timing (based on displayStart) was correct, but the wrong lines were displayed (based on lineZero).

735b7ce35a68b0fbe4f4bd4513363a38426775bd Added new rom information
5890ed7f2f52c8b0387097e2cd2ef0bbfa16cd0d In planar mode (SCREEN7/8), apply address rotation on the base masks instead of rotating the resulting address after applying the base mask. This fixes the isInside() checks and thereby ensures that the notifications are sent out when VRAM changes. Before, there could be glitches in planar modes when there are few forced syncs, for example because frames are skipped. In addition, the computation of sizeMask was fixed, now the MSX2 BIOS will correctly detect 64K VRAM. This is a simplified version of an earlier patch by Wouter. Thanks to him and also to Manuel for testing.

This enables you to use the overlay for TAS usage, without risking pokes destroying the replay (e.g. when clicking the reverse bar). Also added help for the commands.

8fa31033f3778ab48faac079b4ac3b817bbd998a the vram2bmp code is originally written by Max Iwamoto and Vampier to accommodate the MSX Translations activity. The procedure is an excellent tool to quickly dump the whole video memory into a bitmap file with the correct colors and layout.

9e444af5d9ce3ab7a8044a575fc9a89aa3c5c1a1 Removed special cases for slope length when an edge starts at the beginning or end of the screen: it appears these special cases were causing more artifacts than they were preventing. For example the characters on the top row of Maze of Galious are now rendered consistently with the same characters elsewhere on the screen.
7d32dda52c9fb3c7eba48dabfe89a05133fcecaf Copy the PixelOperations object, since the reference that is passed is to a temporary object.
795b644c5a160e403d1b598a4b01271a8a8461a3 Let the edge debug code construct color values using PixelOperations instead of using hardcoded values.
c3b849062d330d55a604ccb429e81bedc845ec0e Upgrade to Tcl 8.5. We have this for staticbindist as well, so, let's be consistent. Also, we could simplify some scripts with its new features.
317d42c243554695b2289dafb2173a9454c0e365 Store two end coordinates per edge instead of one. However, it is still assumed that both searching and rendering starts from the same coordinate for both potential edges of a pixel, which is incorrect. This commit reduces the number of artifacts caused by that assumption (for example the zeroes in Maze of Galious) but does not remove all of them (for example parts of the tail on the Firebird title screen).
5643b7d2acb67440202223e9d64ff825507d6d03 if the ladder widget was set to a height of 8x255 pixels the OSD returned an error and the MOG overlay script didn't work anymore. Fixed by limiting the height to 8x31pixels.

ac2b3814083344425ef5729d42a397f5628a213a Compute the full reflexive-transitive closure of library dependencies instead of only those libraries reachable in 0 or 1 steps. With the libraries that we currently use there is no difference in practice, but the original algorithm could miss libraries that are dependencies of dependencies. Also moved this computation from the "3rdparty_download" module to the "libraries" module, so it can be reused.

630eb8c2418496b5dc043cbc3cbae3e763217598 For 16-bit pixels, use unsigned short, instead of signed. This is consistent with the rest of openMSX. I think it even fixes a bug on big endian machines: pixelBEtoLE() shifts to the right, which does sign extension on signed numbers, while zeroes are expected to be shifted in.

83b906f20eaed1fe05b1195be60ffb2ceca86775 Use our File class to write the PNG file.
92395d7c6a8aa415c1be70d0910532b084109c83 Make IMG_SavePNG_RW() throw MSXException if it fails, instead of returning a bool. This improves the quality of error messages.
64bdbfd7f3ad9c9436b709d42086fa3b5d7b5026 When taking a screenshot fails, throw MSXException instead of CommandException. Inside ScreenShotCmd, take the message from MSXException and throw a CommandException. Motivation: Even though the color PNG saving code is currently only used for creating screenshots, that knowledge should not be spread all over the video system, since it may not be true forever. Also, this is a preparation to allow the use of our File class for writing the PNG file, since FileException is an MSXException but not a CommandException.
cb9aadaf379b5ec77be7e7640b808cd49003e986 Throw MSXException instead of CommandException when writing a grayscale PNG fails. The only user is the Printer class, which already catches MSXException.

8c55e9262e86360576966fe4b5e90c06cf7a1054 although the compile for both win32 and x64 went flawless there was a discrepancy in the naming convention that had been altered by me. Despite the greatest care I had removed one F too many and this resulted in a short and accurate e-mail from one of my team members. Since I do not like to make mistakes I apologize for this error and I hope I will not be beheaded in the neat future.

eef10d1e24d6143871a6cae49e29b437e9b8349a RIP SDL_Image you've served us well. One little glitch has made it's way to openMSX with the removal of this LIB, the PNG transparency doesn't work anymore. This is my biggest adjustment to-date and has been tested thoroughly before committing. All changed have been made by hand since I have no clue how to do this in Visual Studio (or VC++ Express). A donation is welcome in the form of feedback :)

81905da3c5896b7ca6ccc5c58d0cfcd0bfdd7790 Removed use of half-precision floats. Support for it is spotty and on newer GPUs it is not actually faster.

006b15ae29b5925ec78ba7dc2208d4450b1d4caa Output a 64N x 64N texture (N=zoom), instead of outputting a 4096 x N x N texture and transforming that while loading.

1ebf41bffd1259d768c6aa2fddbebc2d70e299fa XML needs a closing tag, if no closing tag is provided it means the code that generates the XML file is not correct and needs to be corrected. In my case I forgot to check the SQL-View that generates most of the XML file in detail and therefore submitted and 'epic failure' (copyright 2009 Guyver800) to the openMSX SVN repository and thus making a fool out of myself.
36520f2e6e472284b834aa603863770b88ec461c updated the data and SQL code to include the translated tag
b2c644e4db5b1206ed67b51e545524e66a6df389 Added analyzeCaseFunction(), which determines which combinations of edge bits leads to which output: if the value of a bit does not matter, it displays x (don't care), otherwise it displays the value (0 or 1). Also added genExpr3(), which generates the top-left quadrant (and therefore the whole table) for 3x zoom. It does not provide much insight into the algorithm, but it does replace 2800 lines of input with 100 lines of computation.

85ef344cd2af1bed77c23b8aea3a2008815970b4 Resolved TODOs in sanityCheck(): The property that the weight of the center pixel is never zero holds only for 2x zoom. The property that a result pixel depends only on the center and three neighbours in the direction of the subpixel itself holds for all zoom factors, but the code was specific to 2x (four subpixels in "subsets") and therefore the assert failed on 3x and 4x. Fixed that by defining the correct subsets for 3x and 4x.

49b83cb2230617bafea1a97ac37b506ec26cdd7a Allow 0 drives if you only have an FDC and a diskdrive connector, but no drives connected to it
cf90a0818979709164037046586fd2ac9d27eed6 Added WavWriter::write16silence(). This is called when recording a channel that is silent. This approach avoids the "silence" mix buffer, saving some memory and initialization time. An additional advantage is that sparse files are written on operating systems that support them, saving disk space if there are long periods of silence (verified on Linux: a 5 MB WAV containing only silence takes 4 kB on disk).
fe57e9c489f2b5aca93a62fe8a3f831b1a8dbdd6 Removed method for writing one byte at a time. It was not used, which is a good thing, since it is very inefficient.

c20ec8733835656fd17beca02b2ba25b52852fe8 Added accuracy to key scale levels. The difference is subtle, but it is audible on the modulator: set "key scale level" to 3 for "generator A" in the "Create Own Voice" dialog of MB1.4 and the instrument will sound different on higher notes.

9072a1a7ecbb6b9c459708745343af3fdf692c2a added more pokes
3a0483c30e8d5fe1428e2a3580a48df4113c9ce2 Made separate code paths for identity color matrix and non-identity color matrix. In the identity case, R/G/B are independent, so we can precalculate the transformations for all intensity values. Inside the R/G/B loop, we only have to mix the precalculated values. This is a huge speedup for V9958 on Dingoo.

827f3b683139e02a8f92759685494e1a48bca5e1 Reverted part of r10519: the original code always copied from low to high, so overlapping regions will be filled with a repeating pattern, while memmove() would avoid that.

42ddb991cb12039d34ffaff97a2927a615373bb6 Do not return a result code from the compression routine; the result was hardcoded to LZO_E_OK so it did not add any value anyway.

70ee3f4c18b217294588862dda05357a1c400aad Do not write pass-by-reference RGB values until the final result. Avoid copying RGB in the common path. Together this saves about 5ms during palette precalc on Dingoo, which is not significant but it might be a step towards more optimizations (moving the cmIdentity check outside the R/G/B loops).
01bb86a13f267a839ffcf00dd87bb2dd65fb33f4 Skip multiplication by color matrix if it is the identity matrix. The identity matrix corresponds to "monitor_type normal", so this is by far the most common situation.
69d707fda1987543ec8c04aa430416377805fa61 Precalculate the effect of brightness and contrast instead of starting from the settings on every RGB transformation. Saves about 330ms per palette precalc on Dingoo.

b8b001e6c5dead3935bc25b9b76042082f4e73b9 I thought an undefined preprocessor identifier would be an error, but I forgot that C prefers to assign semantics to mistakes instead of reporting them... Fortunately the GCC preprocessor has an option to warn about undefined identifiers.
43840964cbd8fa8017f6559ba3a5cc6232b7eaff If a component is not present, #define it to 0 instead of not defining it. This way if you forget to include the right header, you get a compile error instead of an object with the wrong contents.

e0da12c7c1774eb78889410ce20e2bd01316d31c Refuse excessively large image sizes. This avoids claiming lots of memory when using the SDL renderer and making mistakes with OSD commands. I set the maximum size to 2048: full HD is 1920x1080 and we do not even have a scale factor yet to output at that size. Also refuse negative image sizes. Limits are enforced for GL as well, for consistency.

f411c7cdd405dc2b7acd58a0d26f698b4fab6fe9 Include the full options list in the menu info instead of in the event handlers strings. Speeds things up a bit more, not a huge difference, but measurable.
28067fbeda71addc53346dfc0003548920e07089 Store "presentation" in menu info array instead of embedded in the "text" item. This removes the last slowness from the menu up/down handling. Opening a large menu is still slow though.
ce9d86233f03d05e643dbbef84e3c4dede4e897e Inlined the relevant portions of "unpack_menu_info": the construct used to put the unpacked variables in the caller's scope was just as slow as the original list code.
0e8133bd7d5596886b8e3f16e5c480220dab62c2 Replaced menu state stack by a series of arrays. The problem with the lists was that when moving from one scrolling list item to another, the data was unpacked 13 times. This got slow with big lists (directories with ~500 files) on CPUs that are just powerful enough to run openMSX (like in portable devices).
cd01806d91cd60a054f7cc30f314f63d4f8448c9 Changed "(un)pack_menu_info" to not pass any values, as a preparation for changing from lists to arrays. I renamed the "pack" variant to "push", because it both packs and pushes a new menu level and keeping the "pack" name would suggest it is symmetrical with "unpack", which it is not.

d489d5f02e052d3cff6e11738668214bef09d53e Remove "menu_refresh_all", since it is not used anymore and should not be used in the future either.

c9542dc4bb31abd421837aa1f447dbe0487bac39 Moved ownership of CommandConsole from Reactor to Display. This solves a destruction order problem introduced in r10137. Thanks to Wouter and Manuel for investigating the problem. Note that this change means that if we ever have two Displays at the same time, we will have two consoles as well. That sounds more useful than one and the same console on two displays, actually.

74f71eb9260db9b0a637e9cb6ecc04a5ab30c4b1 Throttle handling of LED events:
7efa4e5fc6f93339c5688b35a4ec3389490dd708 fixed 'get_screen' Tcl script:
923f49619760fdf760f54a9bd32a23cf67dd9e0a Added information about the Expat XML parser. It can be a good alternative for libxml2 for some builds since it has a smaller footprint when linked statically. More changes are needed to be able to build openMSX against Expat though.
c3d96888640e069c64a00c989a1837a120f29a00 Use SAX2 callbacks to parse XML. Otherwise it only works when libxml2 is compiled with SAX1 support, which is optional and no longer enabled in our 3rdparty build.
be731e39dce08c28493c20742b1c6d251f0fa851 Do not build libxml2 with zlib support, since openMSX itself already handles transparent decompression.
f3dd540cfe21bd656c9c62678cf1edf3d575a883 Disable SDL's DGA video driver: it is said that DGA is architecturally incompatible with modern video cards. There are input related calls in the DGA extension that are useful though apparently, so I am only disabling the video driver, not all of DGA.
643fa659272b71ffa555af35f5cd50d5c09a3aa7 Load PNG image using mmap() instead of using file I/O from SDL_rwops, which does not mmap().
8db356228f8fabcd8631dec081f30858b3e40c58 Explicitly load PNG images, rather than letting SDL_image autodetect the image format. Now every openMSX build only supports PNG images, instead of supporting more when linking to a platform SDL_image; this avoids the situation where a skin using for example JPEG images would work on some openMSX builds but not on others. It also decreases "staticbindist" size by about 5K, which is a lot more than I expected from looking at the symbol sizes.
357a661b1721357107ad5bf94477ec87487afaa9 fixed reading of gzipped XML files
e572c22ee712d5f577352c6754fe8ca0bfd1573b Compute size of all nodes, sort them by decreasing size.
c3066ca84ddf51cb0bc01fc64bdce979462f7341 Initial version of a script to examine what is taking up the most size in the executable. Works on Linux, support for other platforms might be added later. TODO: Show aggregated size; sort decreasing by size.
7197f51aafb748abaa93602ee4fa1540f56b4bb2 Do not compile "psnames" module of FreeType.
094ca105ef5d98e6a9012eb85e5e757a449091a2 Apparently the "autofit" hinter is not needed for TrueType fonts.
1131d31a380e2cfcb74d8f4812eca41c33c6cf2b Disabled optional features we do not need in FreeType using "ftoption.h".
63202248d225b621d903559adee9c1617b95167f Removed FreeType dependency on zlib: openMSX already handles (g)zipped fonts. This made no difference in openMSX executable size when I tested on Linux, but it should speed up the "staticbindist" build a bit since there is simply less to compile.
31c1f18b9d261378ba347fc6a3aac056da03a592 Disabled all FreeType features that openMSX does not need.
f41be2279b6428e1652193555d3c6c9a64734ee7 There is no longer a need to build libxml2 with SAX1 support.

abf95bb133036ce6cdf87eeb63efe4cf86b1cf32 Some updates for stuff fixed/changed the last couple of days
fd057f9d215784baeb27b14b2c5c0191499255f6 On a 64-bit Windows host, target CPU should be x86 instead of x86_64, since MinGW does not support 64-bit yet and our build system does not support VC++ yet.
c734d82a823f8837967d96cf7b23553c323fdb04 Pass CPU flags to GCC: "-m32" on x86 and "-m64" on x86-64. This ensures that openMSX and GCC have the same idea about whether we are compiling 32 or 64 bit mode. Before this change 32-bit GCC would compile without warnings or errors when ASM_X86_64 was defined, but the resulting binary was subtly incorrect.

4ad8112ecb71f39bcfa2a75abbe340066b12df4b Filled in all information on FreeType. It is now possible to probe for FreeType, even though we have no direct use for that. FreeType headers work in an unconventional way: first include <ft2build.h>, then use a macro that contains the header path. To support this, Library.getHeader() was changed to return a tuple and renamed to getHeaders().

a75acc341bc9f8d19870f16254a9340e964cc340 Removed "GL_GL" and "GL_GLEW". Also removed iterHeaderMakeNames(), since we no longer search for headers in more than one location.
a83f78403ad8c8cf4c8ec36ff2d7adc969931089 Instead of probing for different locations of "gl.h", pick one location based on the target OS. In practice, almost all platforms use <GL/gl.h> and the GLEW Makefile installs the header as <GL/glew.h>.

ba11721cf06c8486d1cbe71c2a09af2fae6ddc27 Eliminated "disabledHeaders": now that GL vs GL_GL and GLEW vs GL_GLEW are handled in checkHeader(), "disabledHeaders" became equal to "disabledLibraries". Well, minus one little detail for which I added a TODO in the "probe_defs" module.
976ab68faaba6f9fa0e78ec6a8ddd675b6d691ba Added TODO about GLEW vs GL_GLEW when using 3rdparty.

a885cf0896afb69aa9273c4e3eff926b28e6cb07 There is no feature to disable system functions and we do not need one either. I think the code for it only existed because of symmetry.

6665efb064b8284bd9356f21f598f01efae3f375 Disable the esd audio driver. The configure script will not find the name of the dynamic lib if it is installed in a system directory like /usr/lib. cd9a39321edba9ccffacbf776eb671e4069f7b9a In installTree(), create relative part of destination directory if it does not exist yet: although scanTree() will always yield the directory before its contents, path sequences from other sources might have a different order or might omit the directories completely. This fixes "make dist". Also implemented installDirs() more efficiently by starting with the full path and only moving up a level if the directory does not exist yet.

483af9e187034688301061a52172ffc007fabd5f New download script to replace cURL.
bd134c5e03ecd36cd0c86c851ba2251a0388c433 Do not build shared libraries: we do not need them and building them only increases the chance of build failures. For example, the LDFLAGS that we pass to a package that depends on another package causes a shared lib to be linked against a static lib, which breaks on x86_64 Linux when a static lib was compiled without -fPIC (which is not needed for static libs that are only linked to applications or other static libs).
bd2941bc4722ae0765d08411e7d0a7941148cd6b Do not put comments after definitions, since it changes what is being defined (an extra space is very harmful). This is another reason to migrate away from Make ;)

8d7228038c4524e694251afc12ae09550a258b69 Use a separate build dir for "3rdparty" builds, since the object files can be different. This is certainly the case on Windows, where different declarations are needed for static and dynamic linking. But on any platform there can be differences, for example because the 3rdparty libs are a different version than the systemwide ones.

204b84d95446996664751a52253585f6461137d2 Avoid automatic type conversions by declaring constructors "explicit". This will likely catch some bugs when refactoring old code to use the Fixed Point class. Also, explicit type conversions make it easier to estimate performance by reading the code.

baf3a8653408594639ea19d60232cb82ae2d6508 Added get/setByteCount methods, needed for ATAPI (it uses the cylinder count registers for a different purpose). Made startShortReadTransfer() zero out the buffer, since most routines that fill the buffer need zero as a default/neutral value in a lot of places.
753b5d09defeac911d51fec9578a23c0329464de Rewrote buffering code: use bytes instead of words to indicate sizes (ATA spec uses words, but I can only think in bytes and ATAPI uses bytes as well); pass buffer pointer to all methods that need it (so the field itself can remain private); fill buffer as soon as read command is given instead of when first data byte is read, this is closer to the real hardware (and needed for ATAPI).

a52107586a06abb7db8a3b535b3dbc450eb84180 Register only one I/O port: 0x8E. Even though 0x8F is ignored by the mapper if no ROM is present, it is clearer to not register it at all. Thanks to Adriano for spotting this.

6805905be0f8d2b707cb4c9ac2359a3a11e726e9 On Linux X11, we never get a HWSURFACE; on Windows full screen we do, but it's slow in use. So just request SWSURFACE in every case. SWSURFACE is double buffered already, although doesn't sync to VSYNC like HWSURFACE can. So workScreen actually made things triple buffered, which has no effect except for slowing things down. Therefore I removed workScreen and use screen (now SWSURFACE) to scale on. Thanks to Reikan for finding the performance bottlenecks.

093e13dbfc437e48b2129633c47939c1425c7371 Reverted "static const" to "const". I read some more about linking and namespaces and discovered that first, consts that are not declared otherwise get internal linkage anyway (no "static" needed) and second, using "static" to force linkage is deprecated, because unnamed namespaces provide the same feature in a clearer fashion.

af3cfde6e969b69525460de529e8f3b2a13ec65d Quick submit from a fix I did yesterday for JoyNet. Thing is to test it on the same machine, you need a verry asyncron protocol. It seems most test programs I used so far assume that every 1/50 (or 1/60) of a second seems a nice interval to assume that the other responded to a state change. And running two openMSX's on the same machine kind of screws this up.

68bd875bd0a9d2cdbfeffed1130529f46d7fbc31 Finally a usefull commandline !
04525c5d8adc6b3a3acb193598e4d842a96074af Now Joost has made the stringstream interface to CMLconfig, I started on creating an easier to use commandline format. This will wrap commandline specified disks,roms and tapes in a correct xml config and configure them this way, instead of having to create an entire xml part for each seperate disk/cartridge/tape.
